Lok Yang TengLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 24 Nov 2018For Robert Kiyosaki, he belives that 'properties' is a liability instead of an asset contrary to what many belief in. Kiyosaki defines an asset as anything that puts money in your pocket. A liability is anything that takes money out of your pocket. Anything that generates a postive cash flow is considered an asset (except salary).0 comments1
